text: The Massachusetts Senate is the upper house of the Massachusetts General Court, the bicameral state legislature of the U.S. state of Massachusetts. The Senate has 40 elected members from 40 single-member senatorial districts in the state. Senators serve two-year terms, without term limits.Constitution of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, Article LXXXII. The Senate meets in the Massachusetts State House, in Boston. ==References== Category:Organizations based in Massachusetts Category:State upper houses in the United States Category:Massachusetts General Court
title: Massachusetts Senate
